Heat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C) and prep a 10x15-inch jelly roll pan by greasing and flouring it.
Mix together flour, sugar, baking soda, and salt in a mixing bowl. Blend in sour cream and eggs.
Heat butter in a saucepan on low heat. Mix in water and cocoa powder. Bring to a boil and then remove from heat.
Mix the cocoa mixture into the flour and egg mixture until well combined, then pour the batter into the prepared pan.

Bake in the preheated oven until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean, approximately 20 minutes. While the cake is baking, prepare the icing by combining milk, cocoa powder, and butter in a large saucepan over medium heat.

Remove the cake from the oven when a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean. As the cake bakes, prepare the icing by combining milk, cocoa powder, and butter in a saucepan over medium heat.
Frost the warm cake with the icing.
